Description: TO MEET A NUMBER OF CONGRESSIONAL AND LEGAL MANDATES, THE SEFSC AND THE GULF OF MEXICO FISHERY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL ARE REQUIRED TO DEVELOP A MODERNIZED SHRIMP EFFORT DATA COLLECTION PROGRAM. NMFS IS UNDERTAKING A THREE-PRONGED APPROACH TO MEET THIS OBJECTIVE OF HAVING A MODERN EFFORT DATA COLLECTION AND TRANSMISSION PROGRAM IN PLACE BY 2025.  IN PARTICULAR, THE WORK UNDER THIS TASK WILL SUPPORT PART 3 OF THIS THREE PART APPROACH: (1) PHASE-OUT 3G CELB SYSTEM, (2) TESTING OF APPROVED CELB DEVICES IN THE SHRIMP FISHERY, AND (3) ESTABLISH AN EARLY ADOPTER PHASE.  THE CONTRACT SHALL SUPPORT REIMBURSEMENT FOR INSTALLATION OF THE DEVICES AND MONTHLY FEES FOR 2 YEARS. THIS REIMBURSEMENT IS SEPARATE FROM AND INDEPENDENT OF THE EXISTING NMFS TYPE-APPROVED VMS REIMBURSEMENT PROCESS. LIKELY, THE UNITS USED IN THE TESTING WOULD BE SUPPORTED, AND OTHER POTENTIAL UNITS COULD ALSO BE CONSIDERED INCLUDING THOSE TYPE-APPROVED FOR THE ATLANTIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION (ASMFC) LOBSTER FISHERY

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAINTAIN A TERRITORIAL AND FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP TO COLLECT FISHERIES-DEPENDENT STATISTICS IN SUPPORT OF FISHERIES MANAGEMENT.   THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS COOPERATIVE STATISTICS PROGRAM COLLECTS AND MANAGES DATA PERTAINING TO ALL COMMERCIAL FISHERIES LANDINGS IN THE USVI. IN THIS PROGRAM, THE USVI DIVISION OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (DFW) CONDUCTS ONGOING OUTREACH WITH THE COMMERCIAL FISHING COMMUNITY IN THE TERRITORY; PRODUCES, UPDATES, AND DISTRIBUTES EDUCATIONAL FISHERIES MATERIALS; AND ASSISTS WITH THE ANNUAL REVIEW OF COMMERCIAL FISHING LICENSES. THE PROGRAM FACILITATES THE COLLECTION, REVIEW, AND ENTRY OF COMMERCIAL FISHERIES LANDINGS DATA THAT ARE REPORTED BY FISHERS ON REQUIRED COMMERCIAL CATCH REPORT FORMS. THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR ADDITIONAL BIOSTATISTICAL (LENGTH, WEIGHT, SEX FOR LOBSTERS) SAMPLING TO COLLECT DETAILED DATA TO SUPPLEMENT THE INFORMATION REPORTED ON COMMERCIAL CATCH REPORTS, AS WELL AS GATHER PERTINENT DATA REGARDING THE RECREATI

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO MAINTAIN REPORTING SERVICES ON THE COMMERCIAL FINFISH AND SHELLFISH RESOURCES OF PUERTO RICO, AS WELL AS TO MANAGE AND DISSEMINATE THESE FISHERY STATISTICS THROUGH COORDINATION OF ACTIVITIES BETWEEN THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE (NMFS) AND THE CFSP AT THE DNER'S FISHERIES RESEARCH LABORATORY.  STAFF WILL COLLECT LANDINGS DATA THAT WILL BE PROCESSED AND SUMMARIZED BY MONTH, LANDINGS (BY WEIGHT AND VALUE) GEAR, MUNICIPALITY, ETC.  BIOSTATISTICS AND EFFORT DATA WILL ALSO BE COLLETECTED TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE PUERTO RICO'S MARINE RESOURCES.

THE GEORGIA DNR WILL PROVIDE THE HARVEST AND THE EX-VESSEL VALUE OF ALL COMMERCIAL MARINE FISHERY RESOURCES LANDED IN GEORGIA.  STAFF WILL COLLECT, CODE, ENTER, AND EDIT TRIP-LEVEL COMMERCIAL FISHERY LANDINGS AND COMMERCIAL LICENSE DATA; AND PROVIDE BIOSTATISTICAL DATA ON CERTAIN COMMERCIAL FINFISH SPECIES.  FINFISH LANDINGS WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE STANDARD ATLANTIC FISHERIES INFORMATION SYSTEM (SAFIS).  STAFF WILL ALSO FILL DATA REQUESTS FOR COMMERCIAL FISHERIES INFORMATION FROM THESE DATA SETS.

THE NORTH CAROLINA DIVISION OF MARINE FISHERIES (DMF) WILL BE RESPONIBLE FOR COLLECING AND PROCESSING COMMERCIAL FISHERIES LANDINGS STATISTICS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE NORTH CAROLINA TRIP TICKET PROGRAM (NCTTP). DATA, COLLECTED ON THE TRIP LEVEL, INCLUDE FISHERMAN LICENSE AND VESSEL INFORMATION, START AND UNLOADING DATES, GEARS AND WATERBODY FISHED, SPECIES, UNITS OR POUNDS, AND OTHER FISHERY-SPECIFIC INFORMATION. PAPER TRIP TICKETS WILL BE ENTERED INTO DMF'S FISHERIES INFORMATION NETWORK (FIN) AND WILL BE REVIEWED FOR QUALITY CONTROL PURPOSES. DATA WILL BE  PROCESSED AND SUBMITTED MONTHLY TO THE ATLANTIC COASTAL COOPERATIVE STATISTICS PROGRAM (ACCSP).

LOUISIANA DWF WILL COLLECT AND PROCESS COMMERCIAL LANDINGS DATA UNDER THE LDWF TRIP TICKET PROGRAM, AND STAFF WILL TRANSFER THESE DATA TO THE SEFSC WITHIN 45 CALENDAR DAYS OF EACH MONTH. STAFF WILL ALSO COLLECT, COMPILE, AND PROCESS BIOPROFILE AND CATCH/EFFORT INFORMATION FROM THE IMPORTANT COASTAL FISHERIES IN LOUISIANA.   IN SUPPORT OF STATE AND FEDERAL FISHERIES

THE STATE-FEDERAL COOPERATIVE FISHERY STATISTIC PROGRAM PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FISHERY DEPENDENT STATISTICAL DATA TO MAINTAIN AND SUPPORT MANAGEMENT OF FISHERY RESOURCES IN THE U.S. EXCLUSIVE ECONOMIC ZONE (EEZ) WATERS CONTIGUOUS THROUGH THE STATE WATERS OF SOUTH CAROLINA.  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH TRIP-LEVEL DATA COLLECTIONS OF BOTH CATCH AND EFFORT DATA FROM OF ALL FINFISH, CRUSTACEANS, AND SHELLFISH LANDED IN SOUTH CAROLINA BY COMMERCIAL FISHERMAN AND RECREATIONAL CHARTER VESSEL TRIPS.  THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (SCDNR) ISSUES LICENSES TO INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING COMMERCIAL FISHERMEN, WHOLESALE SEAFOOD AND BAIT DEALERS, AND CHARTER VESSEL OPERATORS WHICH PROVIDES THE AGENCY WITH THE AUTHORITY TO REQUIRE TRIP-LEVEL REPORTING.  BIOLOGICAL SHRIMP COMPOSITION AND SIZE DISTRIBUTION, AS WELL AS FINFISH LENGTH FREQUENCY AND HARD PART DATA COLLECTIONS, WILL ALSO BE OBTAINED FROM COMMERCIAL TRAWL AND OFFSHORE FINFISH TRIPS.  DATA WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE ATLANTIC

THE FLORIDA FISH AND WILDLIFE CONSERVATION COMMISSION WILL DETERMINE TRIP-LEVEL CATCH, EFFORT, AND EX-VESSEL VALUE OF ALL MARINE COMMERCIAL FISHERIES RESOURCES LANDED AND SOLD IN FLORIDA TO OBTAIN INTERVIEWS OF COMMERCIAL FISHERMEN TO COLLECT ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON FISHING EFFORT, GEAR UTILIZATION, RECOGNIZE AND RESOLVE SPECIES IDENTIFICATION ISSUES AT DOCKSIDE, AND OBTAIN LENGTHS AND WEIGHTS OF SPECIES HARVESTED.

THE TEXAS PARKS AND WILDLIFE DEPARTMENT WILL COLLECT LANDINGS AND EX-VESSEL VALUE OF TEXAS' COMMERCIAL SALTWATER FISHERIES.  THIS INFORMATION WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL IN EVALUATING FISHERIES MANAGEMENT ISSUES AND IN FORMULATING MANAGEMENT PLANS.  COASTAL ZONE MANAGERS AND INVESTORS WILL UTILIZE THIS INFORMATION TO MAKE DEVELOPMENT DECISIONS.    THE COOPERATIVE PROGRAM WILL MINIMIZE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS OF THE PUBLIC AND REDUCE DUPLICATION OF FEDERAL AND STATE DATA COLLECTION ACTIVITIES. OVERALL COSTS TO THE PUBLIC WILL BE REDUCED BY SHARING STATE AND FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE ALABAMA/NOAA FISHERIES COOPERATIVE STATISTICS PROGRAM (ALCSP) IS A JOINT EFFORT BETWEEN THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA) AND THE DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATION AND NATURAL RESOURCES/ALABAMA MARINE RESOURCES DIVISION (AMRD). THIS PROJECT WILL BE CONDUCTED PRIMARILY IN THE COASTAL COUNTIES (BALDWIN AND MOBILE) OF ALABAMA. THE ALCSP WILL ATTEMPT TO PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING THREE (3) PRODUCTS: DETAILED LANDINGS DATABASE, A COMMERCIAL PARTICIPANT DATABASE BY FISHERY, AND FISHERIES-DEPENDENT BIOLOGICAL DATA (LENGTH-FREQUENCY, AGE-AT-LENGTH, AND CATCH-PER-UNIT EFFORT DATA). THESE PRODUCTS WILL BE PRODUCED THROUGH THE COLLECTION, PROCESSING, AND DISSEMINATION OF STATISTICAL DATA RELATING TO FISHERY ACTIVITIES FOR USE BY STATE AND FEDERAL RESOURCE MANAGERS AS WELL AS RESEARCHERS TO DETERMINE IMPACTS OF COMMERCIAL FISHING ON EXISTING STOCKS AND THE ECONOMIC CONTRIBUTIONS OF ALABAMA'S COMMERCIAL FISHERIES.

THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF MARINE RESOURCES (MD DMR) WILL COLLECT, PROCESS, AND DISSEMINATE FISHERY STATISTICS ON THE COMMERCIAL FISHERIES OF THE STATE FOR USE IN STATE AND FEDERAL FISHERY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. DATA ARE COLLECTED UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF MARINE RESOURCES (MDMR) TITLE 22 PART 9 FROM SEAFOOD DEALERS, FISHERMEN, AND OTHER INFORMATION SOURCES. THE CONFIDENTIALITY OF DATA COLLECTED IS PROTECTED AND MAINTAINED BY APPLICABLE STATE AND FEDERAL STATUTES. THE DATA COLLECTED ARE COMPILED, ENTERED, AND TRANSMITTED TO THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE (NMFS) MONTHLY. ANOTHER ASPECT OF THE CSP IS THE BIOSTATISTICAL SAMPLING PROGRAM WHICH OBTAINS INTERVIEW AND SIZE-FREQUENCY DATA FROM COMMERCIAL TRIPS FOR REEF FISH.
